items.sentence: I don\'t think that Tom knows very much about Australia.
I don\'t think that Tom knows where Mary parked her car.
I don\'t think that anybody has told Tom what to do yet.
Send me all your questions and I\'ll try to answer them.
Tom says if you do that, Mary will probably yell at you.
You shouldn\'t talk to a bus driver while he\'s driving.
Tom worked on the report for the better part of the day.
You can\'t buy this kind of cheese at most supermarkets.
Tom did say that, but I don\'t think he really meant it.
Tom always thought he\'d like to become a forest ranger.
Tom and I don\'t usually say good morning to each other.
Wouldn't it be great if we could have a party every day?
A mixed blessing is something that is both good and bad.
I went to Tom's house this morning, but he wasn't there.
Tom invited Mary and her sister to his house for dinner.
When was the last time that you were invited to a party?
We're looking for a place to eat with reasonable prices.
I did the best that I could with what I had at the time.
The weather forecast said that there'd be rain all week.
I'm pretty sure that Tom is doing that just to spite us.
